candidates.name: Alex Familton
candidates.why_elect: I have been a farmer, teacher, lecturer and local body Mayor in the Waitaki area for a lifetime. Politically I am not aligned but have worked with various parties to promote positive policies generally as they affect local people in the regions. Qualifications MNZMBScDipEd. I thrive on problem solving.
candidates.why_stand: We are a rural community with a love of land and a desire to have happy people and animals with access to healthy ecosystems, soils and water. As a member of the Eastern Rivers Otago (community) Catchment group I am determined to hand the next generation an improved sustainable biomass.

candidates.name: Kevin Malcolm
candidates.why_elect: I have experience is banking, forestry, timber company management, risk management, agriculture and horticulture, property development, local body governance, board of trustee chair, community support. I say yes when I am ready to say yes and no when no is needed. Let's get Otago being the very best possible.
candidates.why_stand: It is essential for all of us to take responsibility to ensure we deliver an exciting and sustainable future for generations to come. It is mine and my family's time to ensure that becomes a reality.

candidates.name: Gail May-Sherman
candidates.why_elect: My experience is diverse: I have degrees in mathematics and history; I have taught children and adults; I build scientific instruments. I understand complex technical material as well as human behavior. I own rural property and understand rural challenges. I will make decisions based on both science and compassion.
candidates.why_stand: I have two children and a grandchild. Climate change will alter our society dramatically in their lifetimes. I feel a moral responsibility to help create a more connected and resilient society, and therefore, a better future for us all. I believe this is still possible in Otago.
